properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 19 at 1:33PM EST until January 21 at 11:45AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids MI
properties.description:
At 127 PM EST, emergency management reported that the ice jam behind
Rogers Dam on the Muskegon River near 11 Mile Road remains in place.
No new flooding has been reported in the last 24 hours. Flooding may
develop between Big Rapids and the Rogers Dam Pond over the next few
days as colder weather continues and the ice jam remains in place.
Some of the streets that could be affected by high water and minor
flooding are 183rd Avenue near 12 Mile Road, Riverside Drive, and
Maple Street. Homes at the lowest spots along the river should pay
close attention tonight into Monday as the colder temperatures will
further strengthen the ice jam.

River levels near ice jams are very unpredictable, and can change
quickly with little or no warning.
properties.instruction:
Water levels around ice jams are notoriously unpredictable, and can
change quickly with little or no warning. Anyone living or recreating
near the river should pay close attention over the next few days and
prepare for additional changes in water levels.

NWSheadline: THE FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM EST TUESDAY FOR WEST CENTRAL MECOSTA COUNTY
